articles.title: Kim Jong Il votes at KPA unit
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il votes at KPA unit
  Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) - General Secretary Kim Jong Il inspected KPA unit no. 671 and joined servicemen in the Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) election on Sunday.
  He waved to the cheering soldiers and families and went to the polling booth, where he received a ballot from the chairman of the election committee of sub-constituency no. 1 of constituency no. 662 and voted for SPA candidate Ri Jong Man, a KPA officer.
   He met and talked with the candidate.
   Kim Jong Il then looked round a monument to the local instructions of President Kim Il Sung and the revolutionary history education room.
   He recalled the President's imperishable leadership exploits. 
   He urged the unit's soldiers to cherish the President's exploits and fulfil his last instructions.
   Kim Jong Il inspected the military study room and the shooting room of the unit.
   He noted with great satisfaction that the commanding officers and men of the unit have a high ability of operation command and fighting efficiency for modern warfare. 
   He then went to a women's company under the unit and looked round the facilities for cultural education and supply service, including the education room, the bedroom and the bathroom. He showed them parental favors lest they should feel any inconvenience in life.
   He called for taking parental care of the soldiers' life because they are valuable revolutionaries who defend the socialist motherland, the cradle for eternal life of the people, and the people's happiness and security at the risk of life.
   He gave the women a pair of binoculars and an automatic rifle as gifts and had a picture taken with them.
   He also posed for a picture with the unit's soldiers.

articles.title: Korean voters participate in SPA election
articles.content:
Korean voters participate in SPA election
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The election of deputies to the tenth Supreme People's Assembly took place at all polling booths of Korea on July 26.
   Set up at the polling booths were flags of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, red flags and varicolored flags and boards of "Long live the revolutionary government of workers and peasants founded by the great leader comrade Kim Il Sung and led by the respected comrade Kim Jong Il " "Let all of us  participate in the election of deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly to build up the revolutionary government " and other slogans and posters.
   Celebration stages added to the atmosphere of election.
   The officers and men of the people's army registered at constituency no. 666, who were the first to nominate Kim Jong Il as a SPA candidate, and all other voters across the country went to the polling booths in the early morning.
   They voted for officials, servicemen, workers, farmers and working intellectuals, who have devotedly worked for the good of the country and people.
   As  of 6 p.m. that day all the electors registered in the voters' lists except those on foreign trip and working on  deep sea cast the ballots.
   There were mobile ballot boxes available to those electors who were not able to go to the polls due to old ages and diseases.
   Those who cast the ballots with loyalty enjoyed dances and songs on the auspicious day.

articles.title: Art performance celebrates victory-day
articles.content:
Art performance celebrates victory-day
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The Mansudae Art Troupe gave a music and dance performance "For the Great Fatherland" at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Sunday to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the victory in the Great Fatherland Liberation War.
   The performance was appreciated by Pak Song Chol, Kim Yong Nam and other senior party and state officials, vice-chairman of the central standing committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan O Hyong Jin, together with  citizens and overseas compatriots.
   Foreign diplomatic envoys, military attaches and foreigners were invited to the performance.
   With colorful numbers the performers depicted well the noble spiritual world of the Korean people who are determined to exalt the immortal revolutionary feats of  President Kim Il Sung who led the Fatherland Liberation War to brilliant victory.
   Put on the stage were serial songs "the Commander of Korea," "the Commander Shortens a Hundred Miles to a Span" and so on highly praising the great leadership ability and noble virtues of Kim Jong Il, who is the greatest-ever commander.

articles.title: Papers observe War Victory Day
articles.content:
Papers observe War Victory Day
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Papers here today dedicate editorials to the 45th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the Great Fatherland Liberation War.
   On this anniversary the servicemen and people recollect the undying feats of    Kim Il Sung, who brought the day of the second liberation to the country, and vow to exalt his feats under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the editorials say.
   Rodong Sinmun says the great victory in the war was a fruition of Kim Il Sung's outstanding military strategies and ideas, war methods and tested leadership.
   The Korean people will always keep in their memory the immortal feats of Kim Il Sung, who led the war to victory and fully demonstrated the dignity and spirit of heroic Korea, the daily says, and continues:
   His feats have been creditably defended and exalted by Kim Jong Il.
   Kim Jong Il is an illustrious leader of the revolution who is faithfully carrying forward Kim Il Sung's ideas and leadership, the most outstanding strategist and ever-victorious, iron-willed brilliant commander of the present era who is possessed of literary and military accomplishments.
   He has steadily increased the country's defence capabilities. Our people's army has become an invincible army equipped with powerful attack and defence means and our country has turned into an impregnable fortress.
   Kim Jong Il is the destiny of our country and revolution and the symbol of all victory. Unshakable are the Korean people's faith and will to continue the revolution with him as the supreme leader of their party, state and revolution.

articles.title: U.S. must stop military threat = KCNA commentary =
articles.content:
U.S. must stop military threat = KCNA commentary =
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The United States has announced that it would deploy sophisticated military equipment and troops on the sea off the Korean peninsula.
   On July 20, it decided to deploy near the peninsula nuclear-powered carriers including Carl Vinson belonging to the U.S. Pacific Command, some 20 nuclear-powered attack submarines, various types of warplanes and troops.
   It also decided to issue an alert order to all operational areas of the U.S. Pacific Command including the Korean peninsula.
   Such dangerous military moves which can be seen only on the eve of war are an undisguised military provocation against the DPRK. They are tantamount to a declaration of war.
   The United States would start aggression on other countries with moving of huge sea operational forces. In view of this trite method, the deployment of huge armed forces near the Korean peninsula makes us suspect that it is the dispatch of an advance contingent for the provocation of a nuclear war on the peninsula. 
   The U.S. military moves are an open violation of the DPRK-U.S. agreed framework in which it promised to refrain from using nuclear weapons and presenting nuclear threat against us.
   We cannot remain a passive onlooker to its moves.
   The U.S. military moves are designed to threaten with military force the Korean people, who are dynamically making the forced march for the final victory.
   The Korean people and army are not frightened by any aircraft carrier or nuclear weapon.
   Their revolutionary stamina is characterized by response to strength with strength and war with war.
   If the United States threathen us, its dialogue partner, with reckless military moves, we will be left with no other choice but to take powerful self-defensive steps unhesitatingly.
   If so, the United States will have much more to lose than to win.
   It should stop arrogant military threat at once.

articles.title: Fatal blow would be dealt to enemy if they unleash war, declares chief of KPA general staff
articles.content:
Fatal blow would be dealt to enemy if they unleash war, declares chief of KPA general staff 
Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Chun, chief of the general staff of the Korean People's Army, warned the U.S. warmaniacs, the South Korean puppets looking for  a chance of aggression and the Japanese reactionaries in conspiracy with them against a rash act.
   He, addressing a national meeting held here this morning to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War, said that the military exercises of the enemies to stifle the DPRK are making our army and people sharpen vigilance.
   It is our consistent stand to answer the appeasement strategy of the imperialists with the revolutionary principle, and their armed invasion with a revolutionary war, he noted, and stressed:
   If the enemies ignite a war in defiance of our repeated warnings, our army and people will rise up as one in a sacred war for revenge  and, with all potentialities, give them more fatal blow than in the last war so as to remove the root cause of war from the Korean peninsula.
   The U.S. conservative hardliners, the Japanese reactionaries and the South Korean warmaniacs should know this and act with discretion.
   It is the unshaking guts of our army and people not to allow the globe to exist without Korea but to fight to the end against those who encroach upon the sovereignty of our nation. It is our firm will to build a strong power of Juche in a reunified country as Kim Il Sung wished in his lifetime.

articles.title: National meeting on anniversary of victory in war
articles.content:
National meeting on anniversary of victory in war
Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- A national meeting to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the victory of the Korean people in the great fatherland liberation war was held at the 6,000-seat theatre of the April 25 House of Culture in Pyongyang today.
   Pak Song Chol, Kim Yong Nam, Ri Ul Sol, Jo Myong Rok and other senior officials of the party, state and army were present.
   Kim Yong Chun, chief of the general staff of the Korean People's Army, made a report at the meeting.
   He said that the Korean people won the historic victory in the war by overpowering the enemy's numerical and technological  superiority with politico-ideological and strategic and tactical superiority under the outstanding political and military leadership of Kim Il Sung, a genius of the revolution and prominent strategist.
   He went on:
   The Korean people shattered to smithereens the myth of the U.S. imperialists' "mightiness" in the  three-year anti-U.S. sacred war, shaking the world. They encouraged  the oppressed and exploited people of the world in their anti-imperialist national liberation struggle and made a great contribution to defending the socialist cause.
   The Korean people are  now undergoing unprecedentedly harsh trials because of the anti-DPRK, anti-socialist campaign of the imperialists and reactionaries. In fact, they are going through such a grim war as the last Fatherland Liberation War.
   Under the leadership of Kim Jong Il, the Korean People's Army and people have firmly defended and exalted Korean socialism, smashing the enemy's counterrevolutionary offensive with a great revolutionary offensive in the war devoid of gunfire.  This miracle of history eloquently  verifies the invariable truth that invincibility of the party, state, army and people is guaranteed by the greatness of the leader.
   Kim Yong Chun called for firmly defending the Korean revolution from the enemy's encroachment, strengthening the position of Korean socialism  in every way and accomplishing the Juche revolutionary cause under the banner of anti-imperialism and independence.
   He laid stress on  maintaining the Korean socialist economic  structure and developing the national defence industry to meet the demand of the obtaining situation.
   With an unchangeable design to stifle the DPRK, he said, the U.S. warmongers, South Korean puppets and Japanese reactionaries in conspiracy with them continue to amass huge armed forces and up-to-date military equipment in and around South Korea and stage frantic war exercises almost everyday. Waiting for a chance to invade the DPRK. This makes the Korean People's Army and people sharpen their vigilance.
   It is our consistent principle to answer the appeasment strategy of the imperialists with the revolutionary principle, and  their armed invasion with a revolutionary war, he said, and stressed:
   If the enemies unleash a war in defiance of our repeated warnings, our army and people will rise up as one in the sacred war for revenge and  give them a heavier blow  than in the past war  with all potentialities  so as to remove the root cause of war  from the Korean peninsula.
   The U.S. conservative hardliners, Japanese reactionaries and South Korean warmaniacs should know this and act with discretion.
   Though  our struggle is arduous today, our future is optimistic and a final victory is  in store for us because we are guided by Kim Jong Il, the illustrious commander of Mt. Paektu and there is the invincible strength of the army and people singleheartedly rallied around him.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid before statues of President Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid before statues of President Kim Il Sung
  Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Working people of all social standings, servicemen, school youths and children in the capital city of Pyongyang today laid floral baskets before the Statue of President Kim Il Sung on Mansu Hill and paid their respects to the President to mark the 45th anniversary of the victory in the Fatherland Liberation War.
   Standing before the statue was a floral basket from Kim Jong Il.
   Floral baskets, bouquets and flowers were laid before the President's statues in different parts of the capital.
   Working people, servicemen and school youths and children in different parts of the country laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before the President's statues in their residential quarters before paying homage to him.
   Foreign military attaches here members of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea,  delegations and home-visiting groups of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan staying in socialist homeland also laid floral baskets.

articles.title: Might of Korean people's singlehearted unity
articles.content:
Might of Korean people's singlehearted unity
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Foreigners staying in Korea visited polling booths for the election of deputies to the tenth Supreme People's Assembly here on Sunday and gave their deep impressions.
   The head of a youth delegation of Libya said he admired the free and democratic election, which was quite different from what he had seen, heard and felt in the west.  It is under the socialist system and the great leader that the election proceeded smoothly in Korea, he added.
   A Japanese businessman, Kajita Kenji, said the atmosphere at  polling booths of Korea is entirely different from those in capitalist society. There is no such country as Korea in the world, he said.
   A Russian pressman, Vladimir Yakushev, said with tears in his eyes that  at a polling booth he saw the might of singlehearted unity of the leader, the party and the masses. 
    This wonderful election is beyond imagination in the west, he said.
   Maria Julia Guerra, section chief of the Cuban paper Ahora, said at a polling booth that the election has been held in a very free and democratic way, not by money. She stressed that visiting a polling booth, she could see the might of the singlehearted unity of the Korean people who are closely rallied around Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: End of defeated generals
articles.content:
End of defeated generals
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- July 27 is a historic day when the heroic Korean people gave a crushing defeat to the U.S. imperialist aggressors and won a great victory 45 years ago.
   The following is the miserable end of the U.S. imperialist murderer "generals" in the three-year-long Korean War.
   Macarthur, the first "UN Forces" Commander, acted the victor not only once or twice in his life.
   But his "honor" was not eternal.
   The "Christmas general offensive" of the Macarthur Command, which has suffered one setback after another from the beginning of the war, was shattered in the first step by a decisive rebuff of the Korean People's Army. Not glory but a miserable doom was awaiting Macarthur who lost not only the frontline units but also the reserve force units.
   In April 1951 the then U.S. President, Truman, declared Macarthur dismissed.
   It was on July 1, 1950 that dean, who had shown "valor" in the Second World War, was appointed as commander of the U.S. 24th division, which had been called a "victorious division" in the Pacific War.
   Leaving for the Korean front, he blared that one divisional force of the U.S. army was enough to hold at bay the counteroffensive of the KPA.
   But, Dean's dream went up in smoke at the very start. The U.S. 24th divison was totally destroyed in the Taejon battle on July 20, that was the 20th day after its arrival in South Korea. Dean himself was taken prisoner by a people's army soldier.    He was the first division commander of U.S. imperialist aggression forces to be taken prisoner in the Korean War.
    Walker, the commander of the U.S. Eighth Army at the time of the Korean War, ordered his men to kill the Koreans in cold blood.
    The murderer considered a massacre warfare the best way of his promotion to higher ranks.
    He tried to get "fame" in reliance upon such a "warfare." He got nothing but a death in the Korean War.
    Hard hit by the KPA units behind the enemy's line, he organised the South Korean puppet third army corps and went to Ryonchon to command it in early December 1950.
    But, he kicked the bucket, falling into an ambush by the KPA while fleeing to Jongok in a heavy tank, escorted by the his men in 8 trucks on December 13, 1950.
    Ridgway who was the commander of the U.S. Eighth Army and then the U.S. Far East Forces commander and concurrently commander of the "UN Forces" met with the same doom of Macarthur.
   Height 1211 in the eastern sector of the front was the main target of attack of the "autumn offensive" of massive scale in September 1951.
   By throwing into it more than 50,000 troopers and sophisticated military hardware he made attacks in waves scores of times a day. But, the "autumn offensive" commanded by him ended in failure with 17,000 more deaths than in the "summer offensive."
   The enemy soldiers driven into the attack called Height 1211 "heart-breaking hill" meaning that they lost heart at the mere sight of it and the valley below it "trap valley" meaning that no one who entered it came back alive.
   Ridgway was dismissed one year after he was appointed as U.S. Far East Forces commander.
   It was in April 1951 that van fleet was appointed as commander of the U.S. Eighth Army.
   Finding a way out of the U.S. defeat in the war in the "new offensive," he made preparations for a "model battle" on Jonghyong height with huge forces and combat materials and let a large number of officers, war correspondents of the "UN Forces" and foreign minister residents and consuls inspect the battle.
   But the battle ended in a total fiasco.
   As a result, van fleet was stripped of the general's uniform.
   Clark who was appointed as commander of the "UN Forces" at the end of the Korean war vowed to his Washington master who had been driven to desperate straits by repeated setbacks in the war to turn the scale in the war.
   He called many flying corps out to commit indiscriminate bombing, saying that he would remove 78 towns in the northern half of Korea from the map. The bombing became powerless before the firm will of the Korean people.
   The "Kimhwa offensive" into which he had thrown huge forces, staking his own fate on it, ended in a shameful defeat.
   After suffering one setback after another, the U.S. ruling quarters told Clark to sign an armistice agreement, admitting their defeat.
   Clark lamented his fate as the first U.S. Forces commander who failed to win victory and signed the armistice agreement.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il elected to SPA
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il elected to SPA
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- The central election committee for the 10th Supreme People's Assembly (SPA) of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea today made public an announcement on the results of the voting at constituency no. 666 which took place on Sunday.
   According to it, all the electors of the constituency who were the first to nominate  Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il as candidate took part in the election and voted for him with deep trust in and unfailing loyalty to him, representing the unanimous desire of all the people and servicemen throughout the country.
   This shows that all the servicemen and people fully support and deeply trust in Kim Jong Il,  a peerlessly great man, the leader of the revolution and an invincible and iron-willed commander, who has performed imperishable exploits for the country since he began guiding the Korean revolution with outstanding ideas and leadership scores of years ago, resolved to carry forward the cause of the great sun and glorify Korea, said the announcement.
   By electing him as deputy to the SPA, all the people and servicemen demonstrated their unanimous desire and strong determination to accomplish the socialist cause, undaunted by any adversity, under the wise guidance of the party and the leader, it said.
   On the basis of the results of the voting at constituency no. 666, the central election committee announced that Kim Jong Il, leader of the Korean party and people and Supreme Commander of the revolutionary armed forces, was elected as deputy to the SPA.

articles.title: 100 percent vote for candidates
articles.content:
100 percent vote for candidates
Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- the central election committee issued an announcement today on the returns of the July 26 election to the 10th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
   According to the returns, 99.85 percent of the registered voters took part in the election and 100 percent of the participants voted for the registered candidates, the announcement said.
   Those who were abroad and on ocean could not take part in the election.
   Through the election, the voters demonstrated the might of the monolithic unity of the leader, party and masses and the advantages of the Korean socialist system. The election manifested once again the ardent desire and iron will of the Korean people and servicemen to complete socialism under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, the announcement said.
   The announcement contains that list of 687 deputies elected at constituencies throughout the DPRK.

articles.title: Floral baskets laid at War Victory Monument
articles.content:
Floral baskets laid at War Victory Monument
 Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Pak Song Chol, Kim Yong Nam, Jon Pyong Ho, Jo Myong Rok and other senior party and state officials, servicemen and  working people laid floral baskets at the monument to victory in the Fatherland Liberation War today, the 45th anniversary of the victory in the war.
   Standing before the sculpture of the main theme "victory" was a floral basket sent by Kim Jong Il.
   They paid their respects to the officers and men of the heroic KPA who defended with credit the freedom and independence of the country and the gains of the revolution.
   Foreign military attaches here, too, laid a floral basket at the monument.

articles.title: Wreaths laid at Revolutioary Martyrs Cemetery and Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Wreaths laid at Revolutioary Martyrs Cemetery and Friendship Tower
  Pyongyang, July 27 (KCNA) -- Pak Song Chol, Kye Ung Thae and other senior party and state officials, officials of party and power bodies, administrative and economic organs, working people's organisations and national institutions, general officers and other servicemen of the Korean People's Army, working people and youths in the capital city of Pyongyang laid wreaths at the Revolutionary Martrys Cemetery on Mt. Taesong today, the 45th anniversary of the victory in the Great Fatherland Liberation War.
   Foreign military attaches here also laid a wreath at the cemetery.
   Members of the Pyongyang mission of the National Democratic Front of South Korea went to the cemetery to lay bunches of flowers before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, a great communist revolutionary fighter, and observed a moment's silence in memory of her.
   Laid before the friendship tower were wreaths from the Workers' Party of Korea Central Committee, the Central People's Committee, the Administration Council (AC), commissions and ministries of the AC, national institutions, working people's organisations, friendship organisations, the Pyongyang city party and power bodies and administrative and economic organs.
   Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Pak Song Chol, Kim Yong Nam and other senior party and state officials.
   Standing on the wreath-laying stand of the cemetery and before the tower were wreaths sent by  Kim Jong Il.
   Today, wreaths were placed before statues and busts of martyrs, the monument to fallen soldiers of the people's army and tombs of martyrs in different parts of the country.
